title: Texas House passes Trump-backed map
shortDescription: The Texas House GOP approved a Trump-backed congressional map. It still needs Senate approval and the Governor’s signature.

title: Trump official lashes out at 'stupid white hippies' amid DC takeover
shortDescription: Trump administration officials led by JD Vance fired back at protests targeting the federal takeover of D.C. during a wild scene at Union Station.

title: Gov. Newsom Pushes To Redraw Maps To Counter Texas Republicans
shortDescription:
California Governor Gavin Newsom has unveiled a high-stakes plan to redraw voting districts in his state to counter similar efforts by Republicans in Texas.
Newsom announced that California would hold a special election in November, in which voters would be asked to approve a mid-decade redistricting plan ahead of the 2026 national midterms.
 Newsom characterized the move as an emergency measure in response to a President Donald Trump-backed plan in Texas, which could allow Republicans to gain five more seats in the House. 
Announcing the plan at the Japanese American National Museum’s National Center for the Preservation of Democracy, Newsom vowed the move would “neuter and neutralize” Texas’s plan. 
“We're working through a very transparent, temporary, and public process. We're putting the maps on the ballot and empowering the people. We must recognize the cards we have been dealt and meet fire with fire,” Newsom said. 
If successful, Newsom’s plan would allow California to retain its current congressional maps if Texas and other states withdraw from any changes.
The move comes amid ongoing Republican-led redistricting efforts in Florida and Ohio, as well as discussions to do the same in Indiana and Missouri.
Republicans in Texas have so far been blocked from approving new maps as House Democrats fled the state, preventing the chamber from reaching a quorum to proceed with a vote. 
Texas Governor Greg Abbott has threatened to arrest the Texas Democrats for fleeing, vowing to hold continuous special legislative sessions until the proposal passes.

title: Jack White blasts Donald Trump's Oval Office makeover
shortDescription: Jack White has blasted Donald Trump’s Oval Office makeover, calling it “vulgar” and “gaudy.”

title: What is Trump's approval rating this week? What the polling says.
shortDescription: A succession of national polls released in August show a dip in public opinion of the president's job performance, with some marking record-lows.

title: Trump buys more than $100 million in bonds in office, disclosure shows
shortDescription: Trump's financial disclosure shows corporate bond buys from Citigroup, Morgan Stanley, Wells Fargo, Meta, Qualcomm, T-Mobile USA and The Home Depot.

title: Texas Rep. Nicole Collier spends night on House floor
shortDescription: Democrats in the Texas House of Representatives returned to Austin on Aug. 18, 2025, but their protest of redistricting efforts continues.

title: Trump calls for Fed governor to resign over alleged mortgage fraud
shortDescription: President Donald Trump called for Lisa Cook to resign from the Federal Reserve's board after his administration accused her of engaging in mortgage fraud.

title: Voters split on Trump DC police takeover, National Guard deployment
shortDescription: The poll by progressive outfit Data for Progress also said only 11% of voters think President Donald Trump will limit National Guard deployment to DC.

title: Sen. Adam Schiff creates legal defense fund to fight Trump accusations
shortDescription: Democratic Sen. Adam Schiff creates a legal defense fund amid GOP Trump administration investigations.

title: Texas Democrats spend night on House floor
shortDescription: Texas Democrats are not done protesting the GOP's plan to draw a new congressional map that favors Republicans in the midterm elections.

title: Newsom tops Harris in 2028 presidential poll of California Democrats
shortDescription: A new 2028 presidential poll found Gavin Newsom is the top choice of 25% of California's Democratic voters, followed by Kamala Harris at 19%.

title: California redistricting vote has major support: Newsom pollster
shortDescription: A poll taken by Gov. Gavin Newsom's pollster found 57% of California voters back a plan to redraw the state's congressional maps to boost Democrats.

title: What ‘6 wars in 6 months’ is Trump referring to? List of peace agreements
shortDescription: Did Trump settle six wars in six months? He claimed to in a Truth Social post. He has been involved in several peace agreements, but not quite six.

title: Texas GOP approves Trump-backed congressional map
shortDescription: The gambit has triggered a national redistricting war, as governors from both major parties threaten to initiate similar efforts in other states.
